intro: Gurania pachypoda, commonly known as the thick-stemmed gurania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, succulent stems and large, showy flowers that can be pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wet or marshy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
